core_meaning.normalized_summary: Estrangement. People’s aims and loyalties are out of sync, so large unified action is not possible. But you can still find workable, honest collaboration in specific, limited contexts. The strategy is: don’t panic, don’t force total agreement, and don’t lash out in paranoia — instead, meet quietly, build trust in small ways, and let misunderstanding soften.

初九：悔亡，喪馬勿逐，自復；見惡人，無咎。

lines.normalized_meaning: Regret fades. What’s gone will come back on its own — no chasing. You can even engage with people you consider ‘bad’ without harm, as long as you stay clear and don’t escalate.

translations.text: 2. The second line, undivided, shows its subject happening to meet with his lord in a bye-passage. There will be no error.

lines.normalized_meaning: A quiet, offstage meeting with real authority. Loyalty is recognized in private, not ceremony. This low-profile contact is blameless.

lines.normalized_meaning: You’re stopped, humiliated, punished. The start is ugly. But if you endure, the end can still come out right.

lines.normalized_meaning: When you feel cut off, you start seeing threats everywhere — filthy pigs, ghosts, attackers. You almost shoot. Then you realize it’s not an enemy, it’s kin. Misunderstanding dissolves like welcome rain, and fortune returns.
